intro: Candollea turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan candollea, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in dense inflorescences, and are often pink or red in color. Candollea turkestanica is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
